Package it.polimi.ingsw.Model.Goals.CommonGoals

package it.polimi.ingsw.Model.Goals.CommonGoals
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    CommonGoal
    This abstract class represents all the Common Goals in the game and implements the Goal interface with the isAchieved() method to check whether the goal is achieved or not.
    CommonGoal01
    This class represents the CommonGoals number 0 and 1 CommonGoal description: numberOfGroups groups each containing at least dim tiles of the same type.
    CommonGoal0Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal01 class for goal 0.
    CommonGoal10
    This class represents Common Goal number 10, which states that the goal is achieved when there are five tiles of the same color forming an X in the Bookshelf.
    CommonGoal10Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal10 class.
    CommonGoal11
    This class represents Common Goal 11.
    CommonGoal11Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal11 class.
    CommonGoal1Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal01 class for goal 1.
    CommonGoal2
    This class represents the CommonGoal 2 This goal is achieved when there are 4 tiles of the same ElementType placed in the 4 corners of the player's Bookshelf
    CommonGoal2Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal2 class.
    CommonGoal3
    This class represents the CommonGoal 3 This goal is achieved if the board contains at least 2 of the following group of tiles.
    CommonGoal3Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal3 class.
    CommonGoal4
    This class represents Common Goal number 4, which states that a player must have three different columns of six consecutive tiles with no more than three different colors in each column.
    CommonGoal4Test
    This class is used to test the isAchieved() method for CommonGoal4.
    CommonGoal5
    This class represents Common Goal number 5, which is achieved when there are 8 elements of the same type in the whole Bookshelf.
    CommonGoal5Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal5 class.
    CommonGoal6
    This class represents Common Goal number 6, which is achieved when there are 5 diagonally placed tiles of the same ElementType in the Bookshelf.
    CommonGoal6Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal6 class.
    CommonGoal7
    This class represents Common Goal number 7, which states that a player must have four different rows of five consecutive tiles with no more than three different colors in each row.
    CommonGoal7Test
    Unit tests for CommonGoal7 class.
    CommonGoal8
    This class represents Common Goal number 8, which states that the goal is achieved when there are two columns, each formed by 6 different types of tiles, in the Bookshelf.
    CommonGoal8Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal8 class.
    CommonGoal9
    This class represents Common Goal number 9, which states that the goal is achieved when there are two lines, each formed by 5 different types of tiles, in the Bookshelf.
    CommonGoal9Test
    Unit tests for the CommonGoal9 class.
